pages.title: Blood Centrifuge
pages.text: The <item>blood centrifuge/$ is used as part of the <thing>$(l:crossroads:witchcraft/cloning)cloning process/$, to turn <item>$(l:crossroads:witchcraft/syringe#blood)blood pouches/$ into <item>centrifuged blood pouches/$.$(br2)It can process two items at a time and takes a <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/rotary)rotary/$ connection to the top. One operation <em>always/$ takes 5 seconds, regardless of whether it has

<thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/rotary)rotary/$ power or not.$(br2)The created <item>centrifuged blood pouch/$ will gain <thing>$(l:crossroads:witchcraft/cloning#degradation)degradation/$ based on the <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/rotary)rotary speed/$ while running. If it isn't powered at all, all the <thing>$(l:crossroads:witchcraft/cloning#degradation)degradation/$ may make it totally useless.$(br2)While running, the <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/rotary)rotary speed/$ needs to be kept as close to the target speed as possible. The target

speed starts at 0rad/s, and increases linearly while running up to 10rad/s, so the target speed being aimed for changes during the crafting operation. The spin direction doesn't matter (positive and negative speed are both fine).$(br2)The <thing>$(l:crossroads:intro/rotary)rotary speed/$ doesn't need to be perfect, but the better it is, the less <thing>$(l:crossroads:witchcraft/cloning#degradation)degradation/$. It is possible to

have 0 <thing>$(l:crossroads:witchcraft/cloning#degradation)degradation/$ gain.$(br2)The created <item>centrifuged blood pouch/$ will <thing>$(l:crossroads:witchcraft/spoilage)spoil/$ at the same time that the original <item>$(l:crossroads:witchcraft/syringe#blood)blood pouches/$ would have (the <item>blood centrifuge/$ doesn't reset the <thing>$(l:crossroads:witchcraft/spoilage)spoilage/$ timer).$(br2)<thing>$(l:essentials/circuits)Circuits/$ read the current target speed, in rad/s.$(br2)
